intro: Chrysanthemum kermanense, commonly known as the Kerman chrysanthemum, is a flowering plant native to the Kerman region of Iran. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows as an annual or biennial herb, reaching heights of up to 60 centimeters. Its yellow to orange flowers bloom in the autumn, and it is valued for its ornamental qualities. The leaves are usually alternate, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs.
